intro: Cardamine arenicola f. gracillima, commonly known as the slender rock buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers with five sepals and numerous stamens. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
